knimeNode.name: Python Object Writer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows execution of a Python script in a local Python installation.

fullDescription.intro: Allows execution of a Python script in a local Python installation. The path to the Python executable has to be configured in Preferences → KNIME → Python.

tab.name: Script
tab.option:
The script that will be executed. Execute script will execute the full script while execute selection will only execute the currently selected script.
The editor optionally provides autocompletion (CTRL + Space) if the Python module jedi is installed.
The list contains the available flow variables. A double click will insert the corresponding identifier at the current cursor position in the editor.
Lists the currently defined identifiers in the running Python instance. Reset workspace will remove all definitions and reinsert only the input data.
Displays the standard and error output of the execution as well as other relevant information.

ports.inPort: The input object. In the Python script it is available under the name input_object .

views.view: The text sent by Python to the standard output, during the execution of this node.
The text sent by Python to the error output, during the execution of this node.
